column4: Can you make apt-get (not aptitude) say "install this package, but not a certain recommended package"? For example, if I want ubuntu-restricted-extras but not Flash?

ubuntu-restricted-extras is a metapackage that depends on other packages, such as flashplugin-nonfree.  If you use your favorite package manager to show you its dependencies, then you could install any or all of them manually.

that marks them all as manually installed in /var/lib/apt/extended_states; I want them automatically installed. Installing the metapackage and then removing the unwanted packages has the desired effect, but requires installing and removing.
Thats a better question for #ubuntu-devel or #ayatana (which is the desktop experience team)
